text: Richard Charles Albert Holbrooke (April 24, 1941 - December 13, 2010) was an American diplomat. He became well-known when he helped broker the Dayton peace agreement, together with Carl Bildt. This agreement of 1995 helped end the war in Bosnia-Herzegovina. He died of a torn aorta on December 13, 2010. ==Early life== Holbrooke was born to Dan and Trudi Holbrooke on April 24, 1941 in Manhattan, New York. He had a brother, Andrew, who He attended Scarsdale High School, before going to Brown University and the Princeton University. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:2010 deaths Category:American diplomats Category:United States Ambassadors to the United Nations Category:Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany Category:Politicians from New York City Category:Deaths from aortic dissection
title: Richard Holbrooke
